iati-activity.title: IR 029: EXTERNAL COMMUNICATIONS
iati-activity.description: ;IR 029: EXTERNAL COMMUNICATIONS

IR 029: External Communications Media, children, faith-based, traditional and Civil Society organisations have increasedinformation, capacity and platforms to ethically report and advocate for children's issues, particularly among the most deprivedand vulnerable children

indicator.description: Ethical guidelines on reporting for children are institutionalised in academic organisations and media houses.

target.value: Guidelines developed and institutionalised in 3 academic organisations and media houses.

indicator.description: At least 10 partnerships established with media houses/children's organisations for child rights advocacy.

conditions.condition: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

iati-activity.title: OUTPUT 005 BIRTH REGISTRATION
iati-activity.description: ;OUTPUT 005 BIRTH REGISTRATION

5.2 The electronic processess for birth registration is improved, including equipping Upper East Region with necessary ICTresources; up-dating and streamlining current software practices and processes. SUB-NATIONAL IMPLEMENTATION

contact-info.mailing-address: 4-8 Rangoon Close Ward 24 P.O. Box 5051 Cantoments Accra

indicator.description: Proportion of children from the poorest quintiles under the age of 5 registered

actual.value: Wealth quintile reports are usually updated from studies and surveys from MICS DHS among others. The 2014 DHS would be used to update in 2015

indicator.description: Proportion of children under the age of 1 registered

actual.value: Out of a projected number of 650 118 births for 2013 340 991 births were registered between January and September. This accounts for just a little more than 52% of all births. The Registry projects a possible 64% coverage by close of December 2013

indicator.description: Proportion of children under the age of 5 registered in rural communities

actual.value: The Births and Deaths Registry is currently being supported to produce disaggregated reports based on location and children aged between one and five years. Would be able to provide update in 2015

conditions.condition: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

actual.value: 15% in 3 deprived districts (baseline established in 2012)

iati-activity.title: OUTPUT 8 CHILDREN IN CONFLICT WITH THE L
iati-activity.description: ;OUTPUT 8 CHILDREN IN CONFLICT WITH THE L

Output 7: There is increased effort to prevent children coming in conflict with the law and effective and appropriate mechanismsexists for dealing with cases of juvenile offending through informal, community-based processes.

contact-info.mailing-address: 4-8 Rangoon Close Ward 24 P.O. Box 5051 Cantoments Accra

indicator.description: Number of stakeholders (police and others) engaged in crime prevention at community district regional and national level targeting children and young people.

actual.value: The baseline result and the Child Justice policy are expected to provide the impetus for community preventive work in the areas of child justice based key priorities identified. It is therefore expected that community programs will feature strongly in the 2014/15 work plan.

indicator.description: Districts with effective alternative dispute resolution mechanisms for dealing with children's criminal cases.

baseline.value: Close to zero as per system mapping report of 2010

actual.value: Relevant justice Institutions are yet to be supported at the decentralized level with Alternative Dispute Resolution mechanism. This was due to pending child justice policy which is expected to provide the framework within which these services will be offered. The year under review resulted in strong partnerships with these institutions and it is expected that 2014 will bring about actual services in ADR.

conditions.condition: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

indicator.description: Costed plan for scaling up nutrition and related interventions developed and implementation monitored in focus regions

actual.value: National Costed Plan is yet to developed

indicator.description: Mechanism for coordinating and managing nutrition and related strategies in place in five focus regions Baseline: none

actual.value: Cross Sectoral Planning Group on Nutrition formed and National Nutrition Partners Meetings held at the National level. Similar coordination mechanism will be set up at the regional levels

indicator.description: REACH outputs for which UNICEF is focal agency are accomplished

actual.value: All planned activities that UNICEF was responsible were completed

indicator.description: Number of regional and district multisectoral teams trained on stunting and potential solutions baseline: none

actual.value: To be started in 2013

baseline.value: To be established by end of March 2013

iati-activity.title: OUTPUT 2 CP SERVICES PROVIDERS
iati-activity.description: ;OUTPUT 2 CP SERVICES PROVIDERS

Output 2: By 2016, child protection service providers demonstrate strengthened and coordinated capacity to prevent, promote andrespond to child protection abuses in line with national policy and standard operational procedures.

contact-info.mailing-address: 4-8 Rangoon Close Ward 24 P.O. Box 5051 Cantoments Accra

indicator.description: Existence of coordination mechanisms with clearly defined roles and responsibilities at all levels for comprehensive prevention and response services in child protection.

baseline.value: Coordination mechanisms exist through regional networks for child protection but roles and responsibilities not yet clearly defined. Lack of coordination quoted as hampering factor according to 2010 mapping report.

target.value: Reports by partners on satisfactory coordination by partners for prevention promotion and response to child protection abuses.

actual.value: The responsibility for coordination under the Child and Family Welfare Policy remained unresolved. It is expected that this will be clarified and consensus reached at the next meeting of the Child Protection Advisory Committee. However the roles and responsibilities of the Ministry of Gender Children and Social Protection and especially its two key Departments the Departments of Children and the Department of Social Development have been clearly defined. The draft Policy also spells out responsibilities for the family chiefs queen mothers and community leaders and goes on to clarify the roles for civil society organizations and District Assemblies in the prevention and response to child protection issues.

indicator.description: Number of residential care institutions for children

baseline.value: 133 private and Government run as of August 2012

target.value: At most 100 residential care institutions will remain.

actual.value:
14 residential homes were closed and 512 children deinstitutionalized and reunited with their families. As a result of the adoption reform process spearheaded by the Ministry of Gender Children and Social Protection in support of family based care a near to final draft regulations for inter and in-country adoptions have been developed. This is to be reviewed by the Technical Working Group on Adoption.
A mapping of districts with high numbers of residential care facilities was progressing well. The exercise when complete will provide the needed information to facilitate the closure of more institutions.

indicator.description: Proportion of child protection service providers deliver services in line with policy and established Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)

baseline.value: SOPs not yet in place so no service providers yet applying them.

actual.value: Pending the finalization of the Child and Family Welfare Policy

indicator.description: Number of service providers at district and regional and national level working to prevent and respond to child protection abuses.

baseline.value: TBD early 2013 based on review of existing reports and information from partners.

actual.value: Pending the finalization of Baseline report and operationalization of the Child and Family Welfare Policy

conditions.condition: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

iati-activity.title: IR 38 EMERGENCIES AND DISASTER MGT
iati-activity.description: ;IR 38 EMERGENCIES AND DISASTER MGT

IR 38 : Capacity of stakeholders are enhanced to reduce the risks of disaster and to assess and respond to the child protection,health, WASH, education and nutrition needs during emergencies in line with UNICEF's Core Commitments in Humanitarian Action.

contact-info.mailing-address: 4-8 Rangoon Close Ward 24 P.O. Box 5051 Cantoments Accra

indicator.description: DRR and emergency preparedness and response capacity strengthened of key stakeholders in at risk regions and districts.

actual.value:
Work has been initiated to integrate DRR into the Education system. A DRR manual has been developed.
Capacity of WASH partners were also strengthened and EPRP Plans developed for 4 at risk regions.

indicator.description: All new sudden or slow onset humanitarian situations meet the appropriate CCCs relevant to the context target and emergency level and are measured through high frequency Humanitarian (CCC) performance Monitoring

actual.value: Not applicable because there were no humanitarian crisis in the country in 2013.

indicator.description: All level 2 sudden onset emergencies have a needs assessment supported by UNICEF

actual.value: Not Applicable- There were no level 2 emergencies in Ghana in 2013.

indicator.description: For Level 2 responses a lessons learned or evaluation of the response is completed

actual.value: Not Applicable- There were no level 2 emergencies in Ghana in 2013.

conditions.condition: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

actual.value: National AESOP and all ADEOPS in 5 districts show exclusive focus on equity and quality with substantial budget allocation

indicator.description: financial sustainability of national health insurance remains a key priority for discussions at the health sector coordination meetings

actual.value: Financial sustainability of NHIS remains key agenda items for discussion at Health Sector working and business meetings.

indicator.description: Proportion of DHMTs using DHIMS 2 to track key MNCH indicators as per GHS guidelines

actual.value: 100% all DHMTs are using DHIMS2

target.value: Sectoral allocation to implementation of MAF for MDG5 and Child health Policy is increased

actual.value: All regions have developed their MAF Action Plan. Additional 20 million Euros sectoral budget support made available for implementation of MDG5

indicator.description: MOH Annual Program of Work budgets for priority interventions for attainment of health related MDGs

actual.value: MoH Program of Work has prioritized key equity based MNCH interventions like free maternal health care newborn interventions iCCM and introduction of measles and rubella vaccines

indicator.description: Health sector coordination meetings are held regularly as planned

actual.value: Held regularly and UNICEF was co-lead on behalf of Development Partners till June 2013.

actual.value: 11% in 3 deprived districts (baseline established in 2012)

baseline.value: EMIS 2009/10: GPI: K.E.E.A (CR): 1.01 Afram Plains (ER): 1.01 Upper Manya Krobo (ER): 0.98 Savelugu Nanton (NR): 0.79 Kpandai (NR): 0.98 Karaga (NR): 0.69 Garu/Timpane (UER): 0.96 Builsa (UER): 1.12 Lambussie-Karni (UWR): 1.02 Wa East (UWR): 1.08

actual.value: K.E.E.A (CR): 76% Afram Plains (ER): 61% Upper Manya Krobo (ER): 56% Savelugu Nanton (NR): 86% Kpandai (NR): 88% Karaga (NR): 90% Garu/Timpane (UER): 82% Builsa (UER): 65% Lambussie-Karni (UWR): 87% Wa East (UWR): 61% A mixed trend is observed: 4 districts show good progress while in the other 6 districts NER has decreased compared to the baseline. Data accuracy needs to be investigated as there are some unrealistic figures.

actual.value: K.E.E.A (CR): 94% Afram Plains (ER): 60% Upper Manya Krobo (ER): 69% Savelugu Nanton (NR): 97% Kpandai (NR): 93% Karaga (NR): 59% Garu/Timpane (UER): 110% Builsa (UER): 86% Lambussie-Karni (UWR): 96% Wa East (UWR): 74% Overall positive trends are observed: 7 districts show good progress 2 districts show a negative trend and there was no change in one district compared to the baseline.

target.value: 80% of women receiving postnatal visit within 48 hours of delivery

indicator.description: % of pregnant women attending at least 4 antenatal visits

actual.value: National 87% Northern Region: 75% Upper East Region: 89% Upper West- 90% Central Region: 88% Eastern Region: 93%

iati-activity.title: OUTPUT1 NATIONAL CHILD PROTECTION POLICY
iati-activity.description: ;OUTPUT1 NATIONAL CHILD PROTECTION POLICY

By 2016, Child Welfare and Protection Laws and Policies are increasingly aligned with international standards and made appropriatefor Ghana and resources are increasingly available for its application.

contact-info.mailing-address: 4-8 Rangoon Close Ward 24 P.O. Box 5051 Cantoments Accra

indicator.description: Degree on integration of child protection information/data management systems of Police Social Welfare and other Agencies at national regional and district levels.

baseline.value: Various databases exist but they are fragmented and not linked.

target.value: A national integrated child protection Information management system linking national regional and district levels exists and is being used by relevant stakeholders.

actual.value: Pending finalization of the Child Protection Policy Framework.

indicator.description: Degree of alignment between child welfare and protection laws and policies and child-centered values local cultural and social context and international standards.

baseline.value: TBD early 2013 based on previous work done on legislative review

target.value: TBD early 2013 based on findings of baseline.

actual.value:
A near to final second draft Child and Family Welfare Policy has been developed for review by Child Protection Advisory Committee. The draft Policy recognizes the responsibilities of families and importance of community structures in the protection of children and in addressing family related issues. The wide disconnect between law and practice has to a large extent been bridged as well as the gap between formal and informal services providers.
A seven member core team of experts is being constituted to provide quality assurance further technical input and to ensure that the Policy is appropriate for Ghana and consistent with other international conventions and practices.

indicator.description: Proportion of national and district budget allocated in support of child protection prevention promotion and response.

baseline.value: TBD early 2013 based on previous work undertaken by UNICEF on budget analysis.

target.value: TBD early 2013 based on findings of baseline.

actual.value: In collaboration with the ACMA Section a TOR for the analysis of National Budget as well as MDA Budgets and MMDA composite budgets have been developed.

conditions.condition: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

iati-activity.title: IR17: SCHOOL READINESS
iati-activity.description: ;IR17: SCHOOL READINESS
IR17: Young children's school readiness improved through increased access to quality pre-school education programmes in at least 10deprived districts

contact-info.mailing-address: 4-8 Rangoon Close Ward 24 P.O. Box 5051 Cantoments Accra

indicator.description: Primary Net Admission Rate (NAR)

baseline.value: K.E.E.A (CR): 59%: Afram Plains (ER): 65% : Upper Manya Krobo (ER):57% Savlugu Nanton (NR) 70% Kpandai (NR): 64% Karaga (NR): 78% Garu/Timpane (UER): 71% Builsa (UER) : 79% Lambussie-Karni (UWR): 82% Wa East (UWR): 81%

target.value: 2016: At least 90% for NAR in all 10 districts

actual.value: K.E.E.A (CR): 60% Afram Plains (ER): 63% Upper Manya Krobo (ER):43% Savlugu Nanton (NR) 75% Kpandai (NR): 86% Karaga (NR): 95% Garu/Timpane (UER): 67% Builsa (UER) : 67% Lambussie-Karni (UWR): 85% Wa East (UWR): 77%

indicator.description: Kindergarten (KG) Net Enrolment Rate (NER)

baseline.value: K.E.E.A (CR): 46%: Afram Plains (ER): 45% Upper Manya Krobo (ER): 49% Savelugu Nanton (NR): 76% Kpandai (NR): 52% Karaga (NR) : 68% Garu/Timpane (UER): 47% Builsa (UER) : 52% Lambussie-Karni (UWR):48% Wa East (UWR): 38%

target.value: 2016: At least 80% for Net Enrolment Rate (NER) in all 10 districts

actual.value: K.E.E.A (CR): 42% Afram Plains (ER): 45% Upper Manya Krobo (ER):56% Savlugu Nanton (NR) 93% Kpandai (NR): 68% Karaga (NR):107% Garu/Timpane (UER): 48% Builsa (UER) : 54% Lambussie-Karni (UWR): 78% Wa East (UWR): 35%

iati-activity.title: IR 028: M&E
iati-activity.description: ;IR 028: M&E

28: The Government of Ghana is supported to generate and use equity-focused data, evidence-based evaluations, and analyticalstudies to plan, monitor, and evaluate programmes that protect children's rights at national and decentralized levels

contact-info.mailing-address: 4-8 Rangoon Close Ward 24 P.O. Box 5051 Cantoments Accra

indicator.description: Key MDAs have robust costed planning and M&E strategies that follow NDPC's Planning and M&E Guidelines

baseline.value: Concept note for Joint Stategy for Monitoring Evaluations and Statistics (JASMES)

target.value: JASMES developed funded and implemented by Key MDAs.

actual.value: 20 of 28 MDAs have good quality M&E Strategy

indicator.description: An annual analysis of the impact of decentralisation on delivery of children's services is available and utilised to improve services for the most deprived children.

actual.value: Baseline complete

indicator.description: Key surveys studies and evaluations are conducted to provide evidence-based analysis on the situation of children and women.

target.value: GLSS and Labor Force Survey includes child indicators MICS 2014 is conducted

actual.value: MICS completed and launched.

iati-activity.title: IR 025 NATIONAL SOC PROTECTION STRATEGY
iati-activity.description: ;IR 025 NATIONAL SOC PROTECTION STRATEGY

IR025: National Soc Protection Strategy ion Strategy is operationalized to deliver a minimum package of three social protectiservices for women and children based on a common targeting mechanism (CTM).

contact-info.mailing-address: 4-8 Rangoon Close Ward 24 P.O. Box 5051 Cantoments Accra

indicator.description: An M&E Framework for LEAP is developed regular monitoring and reporting occurs and an impact evaluation is completed.

baseline.value: No M&E Framework No regular monitoring and reporting Impact Evaluation Baseline completed.

target.value: M&E Framework developed Regular monitoring with annual reports Impact Evaluation Completed.

actual.value: The TOR for the design and development of the M&E framework was developed and advertized. The bids are being evaluated technically and financially following which a winning firm will be selected to develop the M&E Framework.

indicator.description: Number of ministries using the CTM to select beneficiaries for some of their services

actual.value: 2 ministries using the CTM to select beneficiaries - Social Welfare with the LEAP programme and Ministry of Health with Free Health Insurance for indigents.

indicator.description: Number of households benefiting from the three integrated social protection services

actual.value: 70 191 households benefiting from integrated social protection services

indicator.description: Percent of LEAP payments that are made each year according to the pre-determined schedule

actual.value: 1/3 of LEAP payments have been made according to the pre-determined schedule.

conditions.condition: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

iati-activity.title: OUTPUT 007 CHILD JUSTICE SERVICES
iati-activity.description: ;OUTPUT 007 CHILD JUSTICE SERVICES
By 2016, justice system actors apply principles and laws on child justice and programmes are increasingly available in support ofyoung offenders, child victims and witnesses.

contact-info.mailing-address: 4-8 Rangoon Close Ward 24 P.O. Box 5051 Cantoments Accra

indicator.description: Proportion of child victims and child witnesses benefiting from structural support programmes.

actual.value: On the basis of the baseline and the policy support will be provided to the justice sector to put in place program of support for child victims and witnesses from 2014.

indicator.description: Number of juvenile justice cases diverted at police and court level

actual.value: For 2013 70 children in contact with the law received legal Aid and representation from legal Aid Scheme. The availability of these lawyers ensured that the children were not held in detention facilities. It further resulted in speedy trial for affected children. Efforts are also underway to support the Ghana police Service to develop a Standard Operating Procedure for handling children in contact with the law and integrate Child protection into the training schools. It is expected that be end of 2014 more children will be diverted from the justice system

indicator.description: Proportion of young offenders benefitting from structured programmes for social reintegration and being offered legal aid.

actual.value: Structured program for children in contact with the law is yet to happen. This is due to fact that the Child Protection Policy is yet to be finalized and once that is done structured program for reintegration will become part of the implementation of the policy by service providers. It is further anticipated that engagement with CSOs will also facilitate the program for reintegration of young offenders.

indicator.description: Proportion of justice system actors delivering justice in line with established Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)/guidelines/court directives/legal instruments

baseline.value: SOP/guidelines/court directives/legal instruments not yet in place so no service providers yet applying them.

actual.value: The development of standards for delivery services for children was paused pending finalization of the child protection policy. Once policy is finalized by the end of first quarter of 2014. most of the justice institutions will be support through capacity development which includes the development of manuals SOPs and training.

conditions.condition: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

baseline.value: to be determined by the end of March 2013

actual.value: To be reconciled by June 2014

iati-activity.description: ;IR013: SCALE-UP OF PMTCT AND EID SERVICE

IR / OUTPUT 013: GHS has capacity and resources to plan, coordinate, implement and monitor scale-up of PMTCT and EID services forwomen and children in at least two regions with the highest HIV prevalence.

contact-info.mailing-address: 4-8 Rangoon Close Ward 24 P.O. Box 5051 Cantoments Accra

indicator.description: Proportion of targeted health workers trained for providing integrated PMTCT services

actual.value: Fifty one percent of health facilities with trained health staff are providing integrated package of PMTCT services

indicator.description: % of HIV positive pregnant women receiving ARV prophylaxis in two focus regions

actual.value: Eastern Region -100% Central Region - 85%

indicator.description: % of newborn babies born from HIV positive mothers receiving EID services at least in one focus region

actual.value: Eastern Region - 20% Central Region -15%

indicator.description: Availability of costed scale-up plan for PMTCT incorporating latest evidence and programmtaic guidance

actual.value: Two Regions (Eastern and Central) have approved regional plans and 38 district micro plans. Barriers and bottlenecks exist to operationalize them due to limited resources and commodities.

indicator.description: Availability of the trained staff on PMTCT guidelines in two focus regions

actual.value: Staff providing PMTCT/EID/Pediatric ART Services in all 21 Districts in Eastern Region have been trained.

conditions.condition: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

iati-activity.title: IR 026 C4D
iati-activity.description: ;IR 026 C4D
26.19 Building the capacity of Government, NGO, CBO and community level mobilisers to promote behaviour and social change.

contact-info.mailing-address: 4-8 Rangoon Close Ward 24 P.O. Box 5051 Cantoments Accra

indicator.description: Number of families in the 4 regions of Ghana (Upper East Upper West Northern and Central) who are knowledgeable about key health and hygiene practices contributing to reduction of child mortality and morbidity (breasfeeding and complementary feeding malaria skilled attendance hand washing & ORS rehidratation)

actual.value: Evaluation of LLIN usage has doubled during the last year (approx. 65% of the target population sleeps under an LLIN every night). However data on the other behaviours will be available through the mid term evaluation of the randomized control trial (RCT) which will be done in mid 2014

indicator.description: Ghana Health Service coordinates effectively multi-level multi-channel C4D interventions in four target regions

actual.value: GHS has been able to cover the selected districts of the balance 2 regions focusing on the roll-out of all the key behaviours. Targeted districts within the four regions achieved. Scale up to cover the balance districts in these 4 regions inprogress

indicator.description: Number of C4D partners at national regional and district level capacitated and engaged in the implementation of the multisectoral C4D strategy

actual.value: 4 more partners have been trained on C4D planning and implementation. Target of 7 partners has been achieved. However due to the scale up of C4D initiatives more new partners will be trained during 2014 and 2015

conditions.condition: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

iati-activity.title: IR22: QUALITY TEACHING AND LEARNING
iati-activity.description: ;IR22: QUALITY TEACHING AND LEARNING
IR22: Quality of teaching and learning improved through the practice of child-centred, activity-based teaching in primary schoolsin at least 10 deprived districts

contact-info.mailing-address: 4-8 Rangoon Close Ward 24 P.O. Box 5051 Cantoments Accra

indicator.description: % of primary schools that meet minimum CFS standards in 10 districts

actual.value: 9% in 3 deprived districts.

indicator.description: Teachers Attendance Rate (TAR)

actual.value: Savelugu: 79% Lambussie: 79% Garu-Tempane: 90% (baseline established in 2012)

indicator.description: % of Teachers practicing child-centred activity-based teaching

actual.value: 51% in 3 deprived districts (baseline established in 2012)

indicator.description: % of Primary Schools with trained Head teachers on leadership for Learning

actual.value: 0% - Training module on leadership for learning being finalized

indicator.description: % of schools that meet CFS standards on effective teaching and learning (Dimension 2)

actual.value: 15% in 3 deprived districts (baseline established in 2012)

indicator.description: % of existing core textbooks against needs (national standard of pupil/core textbook ratio of 1:3) in 10 districts

actual.value: K.E.E.A (CR): 40% Afram Plains (ER): 22% Upper Manya Krobo (ER):25% Savlugu Nanton (NR) 39% Kpandai (NR): 14% Karaga (NR):31% Garu/Timpane (UER): 20% Builsa (UER) : 61% Lambussie-Karni (UWR): 14% Wa East (UWR): 25%. The situation is deteriorating in all the districts but one. Textbooks are in a severe shortage in most primary schools.

indicator.description: % of existing trained teachers against needs (national standard of pupil/teacher ratio of 35:1) in 10 districts

actual.value: K.E.E.A (CR): 69% Afram Plains (ER): 57% Upper Manya Krobo (ER): 67% Savlugu Nanton (NR): 64% Kpandai (NR): 27% Karaga (NR):35% Garu/Timpane (UER): 27% Builsa (UER) : 45% Lambussie-Karni (UWR): 38% Wa East (UWR): 33%. A mixed trend is observed: 5 districts show good progress 3 districts show negative trends and there were no/slight changes in 2 districts. Data accuracy needs to be investigated to verify the huge improvement in Afram Plains District.

conditions.condition: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

Number of counterpart ministries with enhanced capacity to better manage knowledge to get results for children.

Capacity of at least 3 Regional Coordinating Councils strengthened to analyse disparities at district level and to implement action to achieve and monitor results for children in the most disadvantged districts.
All AWPs updated and signed before the end of March of each calendar year

actual.value: All AWPs were signed by the second week of April 2013.

iati-activity.title: IR009: NUTRITION POLICY & DATA
iati-activity.description: ;IR009: NUTRITION POLICY & DATA

2012-2013 RWP IR 009 Evidence-based and equity -focused national nutrition policy is being implemented fully and harmonizedsystems for collection and utilization of data on child under-nutrition is in place in at least four most deprived regions of Ghanaand information fed into the FSNMS2014-2015 RWPOUTPUT 09: Capacity of Ghana Health Service and other actors strengthened todevelop evidence based multisectoral policy and plans of action, and monitor implementation in five most deprived regions

contact-info.mailing-address: 4-8 Rangoon Close Ward 24 P.O. Box 5051 Cantoments Accra

indicator.description: Technical assistance to policy working group baseline: ongoing

actual.value: Progress is still slow. UNICEF provided technical support to finalize the draft National Nutrition Policy. Government will facilitate its review and validation before submission to cabinet by 31 March 2013

indicator.description: Costed plan of action developed and implementation monitored in 5 focus regions

actual.value: Plans of action for 5 regions based nutrition logframe will be reviewed by the first quarter of 2013.

indicator.description: Policy and action plan available and being implemented in at least 4 most deprived regions

baseline.value: No policy or action plan available

target.value: Action Plan available and being implemented

actual.value: Action plan is in the process of finalisation

indicator.description: Number of regions for which nutrition surveillance reports are produced

actual.value: All three regions conducted two rounds of Nutrition Surveillance conducted

indicator.description: Number of coordination meetings held in five focus regions at least once per year

actual.value: One out of 5 meetings held (UWR in August). The rest will conduct meetings in the first quarter 2013.

indicator.description: Evidence provided to inform nutrition policy development and implementation

actual.value: Global evidence and MICS 2011 data shared during nutrition policy workgroup and strategic meetings and during the stunting reduction consultative meeting. 3 nutrition surveys carried out in 3 regions.

conditions.condition: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

iati-activity.title: IR 40 PROG SUP. & FIELD MONITORING-ACCRA
iati-activity.description: ;IR 40 PROG SUP. & FIELD MONITORING-ACCRA
IR 40 Programme Support & Field Monitoring - Accra

contact-info.mailing-address: 4-8 Rangoon Close Ward 24 P.O. Box 5051 Cantoments Accra

indicator.description: Percentage of key action points arisen from field monitoring visits coordinated by the Accra office addressed at the end of each calendar year in the 2012-2016 CP cycle.

actual.value: Field visit were undertaken by new Supply and Procurement Manager along with Chief of Operations to understand the capacity gap issues of both UNICEF filed office and counterparts in order to better position the supply unit to address the challenges and gain proficiency in providing service for clients.

indicator.description: Supply requisition without purchase orders

actual.value: There were no supply requisitions without purchase orders. Revised SOPs were introduced for the ease of programme and operation staff particularly to make the CRC process transparent and address time lapse due to incomplete documentation.

indicator.description: Timely and effective procurement and distribution of programme services and supplies in regular transition and emergency situations

actual.value: The supply unit continued to facilitate major procurements on behalf of GoG totalling to USD 33.4 million. This included support to Ministry of Health (MoH) Ghana Health Services/EPI in procuring vaccines and medical devices and procurement of anthropometric equipment within the Nutrition and Malaria Control for Child Survival Project (NMCCSP) as part of the World Bank and MoH Agreement working closely with Procurement Services (PS) Supply Division (SD) and Copenhagen (CPH). Regular coordination with SD/CPH and MoH ensured that critical program supplies are received on time.

indicator.description: Purchase Orders without Bids

actual.value: Supply purchases were with bids

conditions.condition: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

baseline.value: Rural subsector water data-base operational at national and some districts

target.value: Functional knowledge management and decision support tools at national level and in 5 regions

actual.value: Rural sub-sector sanitation and hygiene database for national and regional level completed. Baseline data collection due for completion Mar 2014

indicator.description: Sector coordination structures functional at national and in 5 regions

baseline.value: Suboptimal national level coordination structures exist

target.value: Coordination Structures at national and in 5 regions

actual.value: National WASH in Emergency coordination structures established at national level and in 5 regions

actual.value: In collaboration with partners and ACMA section TOR has been developed for the analysis of budget allocation to child justice services for children in contact with the law. Selected Consultant is expected to submit report of the analysis by end of first quarter of 2014

baseline.value: TBD early 2013 based on previous work done on legislative review

target.value: TBD early 2013 based on findings from baseline

actual.value: Juvenile Justice policy is in the offing. The baseline data clearly indicates the need for legislative review in certain areas including child panel system and development of adoption guidelines. 2014 program includes such reviews based on the policy.

indicator.description: Purchase orders without bids

actual.value: Field visit were undertaken by new Supply and Procurement Manager along with Chief of Operations to understand the capacity gap issues of both UNICEF filed office and counterparts in order to better position the supply unit to address the challenges and gain proficiency in providing service for clients.

indicator.description: Timely and effective procurement and distribution of programme services and supplies in regular transition and emergency situations

actual.value: The supply unit continued to facilitate major procurements on behalf of GoG totalling to USD 33.4 million. This included support to Ministry of Health (MoH) Ghana Health Services/EPI in procuring vaccines and medical devices and procurement of anthropometric equipment within the Nutrition and Malaria Control for Child Survival Project (NMCCSP) as part of the World Bank and MoH Agreement working closely with Procurement Services (PS) Supply Division (SD) and Copenhagen (CPH). actual.value: The office has been able to ensure that less than 5% of DCTs are over 6-9 and 0% over 9 months and demonstrated good performance on all other key indicators.

indicator.description: Total funds not utilized due to expired grants

actual.value: 100% PBAs used within the original duration of the PBA life at least 95% of OR-E used within the original life of PBA

indicator.description: Value of stocks over 100 days in stores

actual.value: GCO does not subscribe to stocking of regular program supplies. Whenever supplies are received they are directly dispatched /delivered to designated government/implementing partners. However supply unit Accra and Tamale continue to maintain certain stock of emergency supplies as part of emergency preparedness at Ministry of Health warehouses. Current combined value of stocks at both locations is approximately USD 100 000.

indicator.description: Supply/Purchase Requisition without purcahse orders

actual.value: There were no supply requisitions without purchase orders. Revised SOPs were introduced for the ease of programme and operation staff particularly to make the CRC process transparent and address time lapse due to incomplete documentation.

conditions.condition: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents
